"On the left or right? It doesn't matter. It's not important."

"I want to learn, adapt, and learn a lot from playing in the center of midfield and anywhere else."

"We will continue to fight in the league. We want to win games and add a lot of points."

replies.msg:
Coutinho: "I was looking to score my first goal but the most important thing is the win and the place in the final."

"This is a very special moment for me, my first final with Barça."

"My first goal in Liverpool was from an Suárez assist? Yes, that's true. I hope I can register more with Messi and Suárez."

Yerry Mina: "I am very happy to play the first match with Barça and qualify for the final. Thank god."

"I am happy in Barcelona, â€‹â€‹with technical staff and colleagues, we must continue our work."

"I was quiet. Before I entered I was nervous, but God gave me peace and my teammates welcomed me."

"Now we have to keep working. Everyone helps me, but, I talk a lot with Paulinho, Sam and Pique."

"The teacher (he calls Valverde 'El Profe') knows what he is doing, the teacher is very quiet."

"I waited for my moment without anxiety. The teacher called me and said 'you will play'. For me, it was a wonderful moment."

Ousmane Dembele's Barcelona Return Did Not Go to Plan Admits Manager Ernesto Valverde

Ousmane Dembele made his return to the pitch on Sunday, after a month out with a hamstring injury.

The French forward came off the bench in the 60th minute of â€‹Barcelona's match with Getafe at Camp Nou, but failed to have a positive impact on the game, according to â€‹Calcioâ€‹Mercato.

Barcelona boss Ernesto Valverde introduced the 20-year-old, along with Andres Iniesta, in search of a goal after his side had failed to land a shot on target in the first half of the game, which finished in a â€‹goalless draw.

Valverde admitted that Dembele did not have the desired effect, as the young forward struggled to have any real influence on the game as he battled with trying to get past his man.

"Dembele came on at a moment when we thought he could help us out by running at players in one-on-one situations.

Valverde was looking for someone to drive at the opposition, when he introduced Dembele with 30 minutes to go on Sunday. But with some lengthy spells on the sidelines recently, the former Borussia Dortmund star may need some minutes under his belt to get back to his best.

"He had to try and use his strengths, which is when he's up against players and driving at them. He didn't have much luck with that today, but it's better that he tried those things than to not try anything," said the Barcelona coach.

Ousmane Dembele's Barcelona Return Did Not Go to Plan Admits Manager Ernesto Valverde

Ousmane Dembele made his return to the pitch on Sunday, after a month out with a hamstring injury.

The French forward came off the bench in the 60th minute of â€‹Barcelona's match with Getafe at Camp Nou, but failed to have a positive impact on the game, according to â€‹Calcioâ€‹Mercato.

Barcelona boss Ernesto Valverde introduced the 20-year-old, along with Andres Iniesta, in search of a goal after his side had failed to land a shot on target in the first half of the game, which finished in a â€‹goalless draw.

Valverde admitted that Dembele did not have the desired effect, as the young forward struggled to have any real influence on the game as he battled with trying to get past his man.

"Dembele came on at a moment when we thought he could help us out by running at players in one-on-one situations.

Valverde was looking for someone to drive at the opposition, when he introduced Dembele with 30 minutes to go on Sunday. But with some lengthy spells on the sidelines recently, the former Borussia Dortmund star may need some minutes under his belt to get back to his best.

"He had to try and use his strengths, which is when he's up against players and driving at them. He didn't have much luck with that today, but it's better that he tried those things than to not try anything," said the Barcelona coach.
